title: Oneworld and BA target UK agents
text:
Oneworld and BA target UK agents 13 August 2015 Save 
Oneworld has teamed up with British Airways to target 50,000 British travel agents and invite them to join its Training Academy. 
The academy features a number of modules to teach agents more about oneworld product and the first module is focused on its Explorer round-the-world fares and takes around an hour to complete. 
Agents that complete the module will be entered into a draw with shopping vouchers as the prizes. 
Other modules will be added to the programme, which can be found at travelagent.oneworld.com . 
The campaign is also being highlighted on BA’s own website for agents, batraveltrade.com . 
Oneworld Director of Sales José María Alvarado said: “Oneworld offers the widest range of alliance fares, and the vast majority of their sales are made through travel agents. 
“Yet there is quite a wide-spread myth in the travel industry that alliance fares are complicated to sell and book. 
“The oneworld Training Academy knocks that firmly on the head by showing how quick, easy and simple oneworld fares are to work with and how attractive they are to customers.” 
“The steps we are taking in UK, with the tremendous support of British Airways, are aimed at increasing the revenues the trade can generate and the numbers of their customers taking advantage of these great value, highly flexible fares.”
